LanguageData.RandomStructureTip: A random structure will be used for your ideoligion.
LanguageData.RandomStyleTip: A random style will be used for your ideoligion.
LanguageData.ChooseYourIdeoligionDesc: What should your starting colonists believe? These beliefs affect gameplay and visuals. You'll be able to recruit others to your beliefs, or take on their beliefs.
LanguageData.SelectAnIdeo: Select an ideoligion for your faction on the left, or
LanguageData.CurrentTotalAnimalBodySizePerColonist: Current total animal bodysize per colonist
LanguageData.MinAnimalBodySizePerColonist: Expecting at least {0} body size per colonist.
LanguageData.FavoriteColorTooltip: {PAWN_labelShort}'s favorite color. Having more than {PERCENTAGE} of {PAWN_possessive} apparel in this color{ORIDEO} will make {PAWN_objective} slightly happier.\n\nYou can alter apparel colors at the styling station using tinctoria dye.
LanguageData.FavoriteColorPickerTip: {PAWN_nameDef}’s favorite color. Having more than 60% of {PAWN_possessive} apparel in this color, or the color of {PAWN_possessive} ideoligion, will make {PAWN_objective} slightly happier.
LanguageData.IdeoColorPickerTip: {PAWN_nameDef}’s ideoligion color. Having more than 60% of {PAWN_possessive} apparel in this color, or {PAWN_possessive} favorite color, will make {PAWN_objective} slightly happier.
LanguageData.NotEnoughDyeWillRecolorApparel: The colonist will recolor the apparel when dye becomes available.
LanguageData.NotEnoughDyeWillRecolorHair: The colonist will recolor their hair when dye becomes available.
LanguageData.Reward_DevelopmentPoints:
Your development points for {0} will increase by {1}.

You currently have {2} development points. Once you have {3} development points you can reform the ideoligion.

Earn additional development points by completing other quests and rituals.
LanguageData.UnableToLoadIdeoDescription: Could not load the selected ideoligion due to the requirements of the factions that will be following this ideoligion. The violated requirements are:
LanguageData.UnableToLoadIdeoMemeNotAllowed: Meme {MEME} is not allowed for {FACTIONTYPE} factions
LanguageData.UnableToLoadIdeoPreceptNotAllowed: Precept {PRECEPT} is not allowed for non-player factions
LanguageData.RitualTargetGatherSpotInfo: Any gathering spot, like a table
LanguageData.RitualTargetGatherAltarIdeogramOrRitualS: Altar, ideogram or any ritual spot.
LanguageData.RitualTargetNeedUnroofedCells: Need at least {0} unroofed cells nearby.
LanguageData.RitualTargetConnectionTornGauranlenTree: {TREE_definite} has had its connection torn recently. It can connect again in {1}.
LanguageData.RitualTargeWoodInfo: You need {0} wood for each participant ({2} total). You have {1} wood.
LanguageData.RitualTargetUnreachable: {0} must be able to reach ritual target.
LanguageData.RitualScarificationWarnNonScarificationI: {PAWN_labelShort} does not believe in ideoligious scarification and will not like being scarified.
LanguageData.RitualScarificationWarnWimp: {PAWN_labelShort} is a wimp and will not like being scarified.
LanguageData.RitualBlindingWarnWimp: {PAWN_labelShort} is a wimp and will not like being blinded.
LanguageData.RitualScarificationTriggerExtraDesc: Scarification is expected for {IDEOMEMBERPLURAL} as long as there are fewer than {0} scarified {IDEOMEMBERPLURAL}.
LanguageData.RitualBlindingTriggerExtraDesc: Blinding is expected for each current and joining {IDEOMEMBER} colonist.
LanguageData.RitualOutcomeExtraDesc_DancePartyWorkFoc: Everyone participating in the ritual gained a one-day work focus buff ({PERCENTAGE} global work speed)!
LanguageData.RitualOutcomeExtraDesc_BlindingPsylink: Thanks to a satisfying blinding ritual, {PAWN_labelShort} gained a psylink level!
LanguageData.RitualOutcomeExtraDesc_BlindingPsylinkAb: With a new pyslink level {PAWN_pronoun} gained a {0} psycast.
LanguageData.RitualOutcomeExtraDesc_SkylanternWandere: Your skylanterns have attracted some friendly travelers. They will visit and leave a gift.
LanguageData.RitualOutcomeExtraDesc_Execution: All participating slaves were shaken by the sight of death. Their suppression has been raised to its maximum level.
LanguageData.RitualOutcomeExtraDesc_DevelopmentPoints: Due to the quality of the ritual, your development points have increased by {2} (from {0} to {1}).
LanguageData.RitualOutcomeExtraDesc_NoDevelopmentPoin: Due to the poor quality of the ritual, no development points were gained.
LanguageData.RitualAttachedOutcome_FarmAnimalsWanderI: The commotion from the {0} has attracted some curious animals!\n\nThey seem accustomed to human contact and are joining the colony.
LanguageData.RitualAttachedOutcome_GauranlenTreePod_E: The {0} has induced a Gauranlen pod to sprout nearby.
LanguageData.RitualAttachedOutcomeCantApply_AncientCo: There is already a known ancient complex to explore.
LanguageData.IdeoBuildingVariationOf: This building is a variation of
LanguageData.RitualRepeatPenaltyTip: Repeating a ritual within {0} days reduces its quality. {1} days have passed since the last ritual, so the current quality reduction is {2}. This penalty will fall to zero {3} days from now.
LanguageData.RitualOutcomeCompTip_RitualTargetDefsPar: For best quality, start the {0} at {1}.
Currently, the {0} is being started at {1_labelShortIndef}.
LanguageData.RitualDevelopmentPointsTip: Completing this ritual gives {0}-{1} development points depending on quality.
LanguageData.SellingAsSlave: If you sell someone to any faction besides their own, they become slaves.
LanguageData.SellingAsRansom: If you sell someone to their own faction, they are ransomed and not enslaved.
LanguageData.RoleBelieverCountDesc: This role becomes active when your faction has {1} {0}. It becomes inactive when your faction has only {3} {2}.
LanguageData.RoleRaisedExpectationGracePeriod: The {0} will have higher expectations in {1}.
LanguageData.AbilityDisabledNoAltarOrRitualsSpot: No reachable altar or ritual spot.
LanguageData.AbilityDisabledNoAltarIdeogramOrRitualsS: No reachable altar, ideogram or ritual spot.
LanguageData.EmancipateNonCololonistWithFactionToolti: The slave will leave the map on foot and return to their home faction, {0}.
LanguageData.EmancipateNonCololonistWithoutFactionToo: The slave will leave on foot and exit the map.
LanguageData.EmancipateCololonistTooltip: The slave will return to being a colonist.
LanguageData.WorshippedTerminalFactionBecameHostileTi: You've stayed in the village too long. The people of {FACTION_name} are attacking!
LanguageData.WorshippedTerminalRaidIncoming: Villagers are returning from nearby to protect the venerated terminal!
LanguageData.RelicHuntFoundRelicSite: The relic is housed in an ancient structure protected by a multi-unit security system.\n\nYou can defeat the security forces one unit at a time, or grab the relic and try to flee before they get you.
LanguageData.RelicHuntFoundRelicSitePeaceful: The relic rests in an ancient structure nearby.
LanguageData.RitualPredictedOutcomeDescEffectRitualSp: Using ritual spot causes {0} mood bonus reduction for all participants.
LanguageData.ConnectedPawnDesc: The person this {TREE_label} is connected to. If the connected person dies, this {TREE_label} will be unable to connect to another for {DURATION}.
LanguageData.TreeBlockedByNearbyBuildingsDesc: Planting {PLANT_definite} near artificial buildings will cause its connection strength to decay over time. Connection strength determines the maximum number of dryads {PLANT_definite} can support at once.\n\nAre you sure you wish to plant here?
LanguageData.GauranlenModeChangeDescFull:
Changing {TREE_definite}'s dryad caste takes time and energy.

After the connected person interacts with the tree, all dryads will spend {DURATION} days inside cocoons while they morph to the selected caste.

Existing cocoons will cancel their transformation so they can morph to the current caste.
LanguageData.ChangeModeDesc: Change the type of dryads created by {TREE_definite}.
LanguageData.ConnectionStrengthDesc: Determines how many dryads this tree can support.
LanguageData.MaximumDryadsDesc: The maximum number of dryads this tree can support.
LanguageData.MaxDryadsBasedOnConnectionStrength: Max dryads based on connection strength
LanguageData.DesiredConnectionStrengthDesc:
{CONNECTEDPAWN_nameDef} will prune {TREE_definite} often enough to keep connection strength above this level.

Higher connection strength allows supporting more dryads, but also falls faster and thus takes more frequent pruning to maintain.

You can click on the bar to adjust the desired target connection strength.

Connection strength fall per day: {FALL}

Connection strength is affected by nearby buildings.
LanguageData.WaitingForConnectorToChangeCaste: Waiting for {CONNECTEDPAWN_nameDef} to change dryad caste.
LanguageData.GauranlenTreeModeDesc: Determines the currently created dryad caste.
LanguageData.DryadCannotChangeMaster: {ANIMAL_nameDef} is connected to {MASTER_nameDef} through {ANIMAL_possessive} Gauranlen tree. {ANIMAL_possessive} master cannot be changed.
LanguageData.ConnectionStrengthTooWeakForGaumakerPod: Connection strength too low to create Gauranlen pod.
LanguageData.NotEnoughConnectionStrengthForSingleDrya: {0} connection strength needed to support a dryad.
LanguageData.GameOverArchotechInvokedIntro: You've invoked the archonexus core. The world fills with a blinding light and time seems to slow...\n\n
LanguageData.GameOverArchotechInvokedEnding: The machine god has noticed you. Nobody can predict what happens next. It may destroy you, or communicate with you directly, or transport your consciousness to another plane of reality.\n\nYou sense a vast, inhuman structure of infinite fractal complexity flowing into your mind. Time and scale begin to dissolve. It's terrifying. It's beautiful...
LanguageData.CannotExtractSkull: Colonist is not willing to extract skull from corpse (missing pro-skullspike precept)
LanguageData.BiosculpterInteruptCycleDesc: Interrupt the current cycle. The occupant will be ejected without benefiting from the effects of the cycle, and will suffer from short-term biosculpter sickness.
LanguageData.BiosculpterEnteringMessage: {PAWN_labelShort} will enter biosculpter and begin a {CYCLE} cycle.
LanguageData.BiosculpterLoadingStartedMessage: {PAWN_labelShort} will collect {INGREDIENTS}, and begin a {CYCLE} cycle.
LanguageData.BiosculpterCarryStartedMessage: {PAWN_labelShort} will collect {INGREDIENTS}, place {DOWNED_labelShort} inside the biosculpter, and begin a {CYCLE} cycle.
LanguageData.BiosculpterNoPowerEjectedMessage: {PAWN_labelShort} was ejected from a biosculpter pod due to lack of power.
LanguageData.BiosculpterHealCompletedWithCureMessage: {PAWN_labelShort} completed healing cycle, and {PAWN_possessive} {HEDIFF_label} was cured.
LanguageData.AgeReversalExpectationDeadline: {PAWN_pronoun} expects the next age reversal in {DEADLINE} days.
LanguageData.HealingCycleOneWillHeal: One of these conditions will be healed
LanguageData.OnCompletionOfCycle: On completion of the {CYCLE} cycle, the following will occur
LanguageData.BiosculpterNoCoditionsToHeal: {PAWN_nameDef} does not have any conditions that can be healed by a {CYCLE} cycle.\n\nDo you want to continue?
LanguageData.ChangeStyleDesc: Change the style this will be built in. This is purely visual and has no gameplay impact.
